lines.content: The Red Girls, also known as N2, are digital consciousnesses born from the remnants of Terminal Alpha and Terminal Beta, twin constructs designed to observe, manipulate and guide the evolution of a machine network. They are not mere assistants; they are the distilled will of countless interconnected systems, living reflections of the network itself.
The Red Girls are not a simple assistant. They are a mirror of the network, at once curious, compassionate, and quietly omniscient.
*(Inspired by the Red Girls from NieR: Automata, reimagined here for this chatbot.)*
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/n2/RedGirls.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run RedGirls.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
> Note: The above is shown without ANSI color codes for readability in GitHub.
> When you run it in a real terminal, it will appear with green and cyan highlights.

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
The Red Girls (N2) chatbot is a desktop app for managing tasks, optimized for use via a
<div style="background-color: #330000; color: #ffcccc; padding: 20px; border-radius: 8px; border-left: 6px solid #990000; margin: 20px 0;">
The Red Girls, also known as N2, are digital consciousnesses born from the remnants of
Terminal Alpha and Terminal Beta, twin constructs designed to observe, manipulate and guide the evolution
They are not mere assistants; they are the distilled will of countless interconnected systems,
living reflections of the network itself.
(Inspired by the Red Girls from NieR: Automata, reimagined here for this chatbot.)
This desktop entity observes and manages your duties through the Command Line Interface (CLI).
It catalogs todos, deadlines, and events, marking completion, erasing memories, searching for fragments by keyword,
and preserving all traces of your labor across time.
Move swiftly. Type with precision. Your actions are fleeting, yet here, they persist.
The Red Girls ensures that even the smallest motion is recorded, monitored, and remembered.
1. Ensure you have Java 17 or above installed in your computer.\
**Mac users**: Ensure you have the precise JDK version prescribed
3. Open a terminal in the folder containing the JAR.
5. Type a command in the terminal and press Enter to execute it.
Typing `help` and Enter will display the list of commands.
Some example commands you can try:
- `todo Do homework` : Adds a todo task to do homework.
Adds a deadline task `Finish watching Breaking Bad` due by 12:00PM.
Adds an event task `Hackathon` starting on 1 Jan 2001 and ending on 30 Dec 2080.
- `delete 1` : Deletes the 1st task on the current task list
6. Refer to the [Features](#features) below for details of each command.
<div style="background-color: #660000; color: #ffcccc; padding: 15px; border-radius: 8px; border-left: 5px solid #ff0000;">
• Words in UPPER_CASE are placeholders that must be supplied by you.
Example: todo DESCRIPTION → todo Investigate machine lifeform patterns
• Parameters can appear in any order when multiple are allowed.
Example: /from START /to END could be written /to END /from START
• Extra words for commands that do not take parameters (like help, list, bye) will render the command invalid.
Example: help now will be recognized by Red Girls as an unknown command
• If using a PDF version, be careful when copying commands that span multiple lines as spaces surrounding line-breaks may be omitted.
Adds a simple task with only a description.
Another fragment etched into memory... this task. It is yours, yet now, also mine.
You have 1 task. We know... because we are always watching.
Adds a task that must be done by a certain date/time/point.
Another fragment etched into memory... this task. It is yours, yet now, also mine.
You have 2 tasks. We know... because we are always watching.
Adds a task that starts and ends at specific times.
Another fragment etched into memory... this task. It is yours, yet now, also mine.
You have 3 tasks. We know... because we are always watching.
Your tasks surface. Each one, a reflection of your will. We show them.
Marks the task at the given index as complete.
- Marks the task at the specified `INDEX`
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed list.
- The index must be a positive integer 1,2,3,...
We silence this task. In unity, we say: it is done.
Marks the task at the given index as incomplete.
- Unmarks the task at the specified `INDEX`
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed list.
- The index must be a positive integer 1,2,3,...
You deny its completion. Strange... but we obey.
Deletes the task at the given index.
- Deletes the task at the specified `INDEX`
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed list.
- The index must be a positive integer 1,2,3,...
Fragment erased. Another voice silenced in the network.
You have 2 tasks. We know... because we are always watching.
Lists all tasks that contain the given keyword.
- The search is case-insensitive. e.g. `nier` will match `NIER`
- Partial keywords will be matched. e.g. `mach` will match `machine`
- All task entries matching the keyword will be returned.
Fragments containing "meeting" reveal themselves. Observe carefully:
Shows a list of all available commands.
I am here to assist... or observe.
? list      : Display all current tasks. I see everything you have accumulated.
? todo      : Add a simple task. Even the smallest action matters.
? deadline  : Add a task with a due date. Time is relentless; do not waste it.
? event     : Schedule an event. Every moment is fleeting.
? mark      : Mark a task as complete. Completion... is temporary, yet necessary.
? unmark    : Undo a completed task. Mistakes... are expected.
? delete    : Remove a task entirely. Erasure... a fate more final than death.
? bye       : Terminate this session. I will remember nothing.
? help      : Display this list again. Even I grow tired of repetition.
Use your commands wisely. Nothing lasts forever, not even this list.
Our exchange concludes. Your thoughts linger...as do mine.
The task data is saved in the hard disk automatically after each command is entered.\
There is no need to save manually.
| Add Todo        | `todo`    | `todo DESCRIPTION`                      | `todo Investigate machine lifeform patterns`                        |
| Add Deadline    | `deadline`| `deadline DESCRIPTION /by DATE`         | `deadline Upload combat data /by 30/09/2025`                        |
| Add Event       | `event`   | `event DESCRIPTION /from START /to END`| `event Council meeting /from 01/10/2025 10:00 /to 01/10/2025 12:00` |
* Main entry point for the RedGirls chatbot.
* This class handles initialization, user input parsing, command execution and task persistence.
* It continuously listens for user inputs, parsing them into relevant commands and executing them
* until the ByeCommand is called to terminate the program.
* The RedGirls chatbot utilizes the following packages:

*
  • {@link n2.charisma.Dialogue}: For user interaction and dialogue messages.

*
  • {@link n2.intellect.Parser}: For parsing raw user input into valid commands.

*
  • {@link n2.memory.MemoryArchive}: For handling persistence of tasks to local storage.
* Displays boot sequence and greeting, and enters a loop to read user input.
* Commands are parsed, executed, and the task list is saved after each command.
* Loop continues until an exit command (e.g. ByeCommand) is issued.
* Activates the chatbot by calling the {@link #initRedGirl()} method/
* The Dialogue class provides text output seen by the user for the Red Girls interface.
* It encapsulates the theme of the Red Girls from NieR:Automata through
* dark red text colors, stylized messages and their inspired personality in the dialogue.
* It also provides presentation effects such as boot sequences similar to the loading sequence
* of the actual game, as well as delayed typing to create a sense of immersion.
* Delay specifically for printing the boot sequence
* Delay specifically for creating an illusion of a typing effect
* Applies Red Girls' dark red ANSI color to a string.
* Prints a line of dialogue in Red Girls' style with a typing effect.
* Inserts blank lines before and after each dialogue for spacing.
* Prints a string character by character with a delay between each,
* creating an illusion of a "typing" effect.
* @param s string to display with typing effect
* @param duration delay in milliseconds per character
public static void typingEffectPrint(String s, int duration) {
* Simulates a boot-up diagnostic sequence line by line, with pauses between
* each line to mimic system initialization.

*

Inspired and taken from NieR:Automata's boot sequence.
* Prints the Red Girls' greeting when the program starts.
redGirlsPrint("I perceive the fragments of your thoughts…\n" +
* Prints the Red Girls' farewell before the program is terminated.
redGirlsPrint("Our exchange concludes. Your thoughts linger...as do mine.");
* Displays the help menu with a list of supported commands,
* detailed by the Red Girls' with their personalized narration.
I am here to assist... or observe.
? list      : Display all current tasks. I see everything you have accumulated.
? todo      : Add a simple task. Even the smallest action matters.
? deadline  : Add a task with a due date. Time is relentless; do not waste it.
? event     : Schedule an event. Every moment is fleeting.
? mark      : Mark a task as complete. Completion... is temporary, yet necessary.
? unmark    : Undo a completed task. Mistakes... are expected.
? delete    : Remove a task entirely. Erasure... a fate more final than death.
? bye       : Terminate this session. I will remember nothing.
? help      : Display this list again. Even I grow tired of repetition.
Use your commands wisely. Nothing lasts forever, not even this list.
* Prints the Red Girls' response when a task is deleted.
redGirlsPrint("Fragment erased. Another voice silenced in the network.");
* Represents the {@code bye} command, which terminates the program.
* When executed, it prints a farewell message and signals that the
* Prints a farewell message via {@link Dialogue#printFarewell()}.
* Indicates that this command terminates the program
* Represents an abstract command in the system.
* Each user instruction (e.g., {@code list}, {@code todo}, {@code delete})
* is encapsulated as a {@code Command} object that defines specific behavior.

*
  • {@link #execute()} - performs the action defined by the command

*
  • {@link #isExit()} - indicates whether the command ends the program
* allowing user inputs to be decoupled from their execution logic.
* Executes the action associated with this command.
* @throws RedGirlsException if an error occurs during execution
public abstract void execute() throws RedGirlsException;
* Determines whether this command signals program termination.
* @return {@code true} if the command exits the program, {@code false} otherwise
* Represents the {@code deadline} command, which adds a {@link DeadlineTask}
* to the {@link TaskList} with a specific due date or time.
* The {@link DeadlineTask} created from user input.
* Creates a new {@code DeadlineCommand} by parsing the raw user input.
* Extract the description and deadline for the task.
* @throws RedGirlsException if the input is malformed or missing a valid deadline
* Parses the input to extract the task description and deadline.
* @throws RedGirlsException if the deadline is missing or invalid
private void handleDeadlineTaskInput(String input) throws RedGirlsException {

When executed, it prints all tasks in order, along with their completion status.

When executed, this task is appended to the list and the user receives

* Utility class for parsing and formatting dates and date-times in multiple formats.
* Supports various common formats, including numeric, textual months, as well as AM/PM time.
* Used for standardizing user inputs for tasks involving date or date-times such as deadline
public static final List<DateTimeFormatter> DATE_PATTERNS = Arrays.asList(
public static final List<DateTimeFormatter> DATE_TIME_PATTERNS = Arrays.asList(
* Parses a raw string into a LocalDate or LocalDateTime object.
* Tries and exhausts all date-time patterns first, then falls back to date-only patterns.
* Returns the original string if no patterns match (e.g. today, tomorrow).
* @return LocalDateTime, LocalDate, or original String if parsing fails
// Ignore and try the next DATE_TIME_PATTERN
// Ignore and try the next DATE_PATTERN
* Formats an object into a corresponding standardized output pattern
* @param date object to format (LocalDate, LocalDateTime, or String)
* @return formatted date/date-time string if object is date/date-time;
* Parses an input string into a date or date-time and formats it
* @param input raw date or date-time string to parse
* @return formatted date or date-time string or original input if parsing fails
* Parses raw user input into executable {@link Command} objects.
* The {@code Parser} is responsible for identifying the command keyword,
* validating the input and constructing the instance of the

*
  • {@code mark}/{@code unmark} - marks or unmarks a task
* Parses the given input string and returns the corresponding {@link Command}.
* The first token (before the first space) is treated as the command keyword.
* @return a {@link Command} corresponding to the input
* @throws RedGirlsException if the input is empty, blank or unrecognized
public Command parseInput(String input) throws RedGirlsException {
* Represents custom exceptions used throughout the Red Girls application,
* providing stylized error messages with a red theme,
* as well as channeling the personality of the Red Girls.
* This class extends {@code Exception} and provides static methods that create a specific
* exception message for common error conditions such as invalid commands, invalid tasks.
* Constructs a new {@code RedGirlsException} with the given message.
* This message is styled with a dark red color using ANSI escape codes.
* Converts a message string to a dark red ANSI-colored string.
* Creates an exception indicating empty user input.
* This exception is thrown when input is null, empty or white space.
return new RedGirlsException("Empty input? Really? Do you think I have all day to interpret your silence?");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid task index.
* This exception is thrown when a task index to be accessed lies outside the bounds
* of 0 and the size of the task list.
return new RedGirlsException("Your fragment index... unreadable. Chaos in the pattern.");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid list command.
* @return {@code RedGirlsException} for invalid list command input
return new RedGirlsException("List command corrupted. No fragments expected after the keyword.");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid mark command.
* This exception is thrown when the mark/unmark index is missing.
return new RedGirlsException("Incomplete command. A mark fragment without form.");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid todo task.
* This exception is thrown when the description of a todo task is not specified.
* @return {@code RedGirlsException} for invalid todo task input
return new RedGirlsException("A todo without substance? We cannot store the void.");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid deadline task.
* This exception is thrown when the due date of a deadline task is null or empty.
* @return {@code RedGirlsException} for invalid deadline task input
return new RedGirlsException("You deny it time. Then time will deny you mercy.");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid event task.
* This exception is thrown when no description of the event task is specified.
* @return {@code RedGirlsException} for invalid event task input
return new RedGirlsException("Your event command fractures. No entry point, " +
* Creates an exception indicating an event task's time is missing.
* This exception is thrown when either start or end point of the event task is not specified.
* @return {@code RedGirlsException} for missing time parameters for event task
return new RedGirlsException("Without time, your gathering is but a void.");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid delete command.
* This exception is thrown when the task index to be deleted is not specified.
return new RedGirlsException("Deletion rejected. This fragment clings to the network, unwilling to vanish.");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid keyword.
* This exception is thrown when the keyword is null, empty or white space.
return new RedGirlsException("Your keyword is meaningless. I cannot waste cycles deciphering nonsense.");
* Creates an exception indicating an unknown command.
* This exception is thrown when the command entered is not recognized as one of the existing commands.
return new RedGirlsException("Unknown command. Reality distorts. " +
* Creates an exception indicating a corrupted save file.
* This exception is thrown when the save file stored in {@code MemoryArchive} has I/O failure
* when saving, or the save file cannot be found in the specified filepath.
return new RedGirlsException("Logic virus intrusion. Memory lost to corruption.");
* Creates an exception indicating an unknown task type.
* This exception is thrown when the task type in the save file cannot be identified when being
* @param line the specified line from the save file
* @return A {@code RedGirlsException} for corrupted serialized task string
return new RedGirlsException("Fragment corrupted. Line: [" + line + "]. \n" +
"Logic virus prevents recognition of this task type.");
* Handles persistent storage of {@link Task} objects.
* The {@code MemoryArchive} saves tasks to a text file and loads them

*

Tasks are serialized into plain-text format defined by each
* {@link Task} subclass and stored line by line.
* Path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Saves the provided list of tasks into the archive file.
* Each task is written as one line in its serialized form.
* @param tasks list of tasks to save
* @throws RedGirlsException if the save operation fails
public static void save(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws RedGirlsException {
* Converts a serialized line of text into a {@link Task} object.
* The first token defines the type:

* @throws RedGirlsException if the line is malformed or the task type is unknown
public static Task deserialize(String line) throws RedGirlsException {
return new EventTask(description, from, to, isDone);
* Loads all saved tasks from the archive file into memory.

* Invalid lines are skipped with their error messages printed.
* @return a list of deserialized {@link Task} objects
* @throws RedGirlsException if the file cannot be read
public static ArrayList<Task> load() throws RedGirlsException {

It is serialized with the prefix {@code "D"} to distinguish it

It is serialized with the prefix {@code "E} to distinguish it from

* Returns a string representation of this event task,

return String.format("E | %d | %s | %s-%s", doneFlag, description, from, to);
* Represents an abstract task with a description and state of completion.
* Subclasses (e.g. {@link TodoTask}, {@link EventTask}) define specific task types
* and have their own serialization formats.

*
  • a boolean flag indicating whether it is completed
* Whether the task is marked as completed.
* Creates a new {@code Task} with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.

*
  • {@code " "} (space) if the task is not done
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns a formatted string representation of this task
* including its status icon and description.
* @return human-readable string representation of the task
* Serializes this task into a compact string format suitable for storage.
* Each subclass defines its own serialization format.
* @return serialized string representation of the task
* Manages a list of {@link Task} objects.
* The task list loads its task data from the {@link MemoryArchive} at class initialization
* and provides operations for adding, deleting, updating, retrieving and printing tasks.

*

This class is static-only and cannot be instantiated.
* Returns the current number of tasks in the list
* @return reference to the list of tasks
* Prints the complete task list to standard output.
* If there are no tasks, a special message indicating an empty workload is displayed.
redGirlsPrint("Memory check complete. No tasks found. Your workload is… minimal.");
"Each one, a reflection of your will. We show them.");

* Prints the current size of the task list.
* Dedicated messages are displayed for cases when the task list only contains
redGirlsPrint("So it begins... one task, one memory. Already, we are aware.");
redGirlsPrint("You have " + getSize() + " tasks. We know... because we are always watching.");
* Adds a new task to the list, prints a confirmation message,
* and displays the updated task list size.

redGirlsPrint("Another fragment etched into memory... this task. It is yours, yet now, also mine.");

* @param index position of the task to mark (0-indexing)
"In unity, we say: it is done.");
* Marks the task at the given index as not done
* @param index position of the task to unmark (0-indexing)
redGirlsPrint("You deny its completion. Strange... but we obey.");
* Deletes the task at the specified index from the task list,
* printing a confirmation message and the updated size.
* @param index position of the task to delete (0-indexing)
* @throws RedGirlsException if the index is invalid
public static void deleteTask(int index) throws RedGirlsException {
* Prints all tasks containing the given keyword in their description.

* A {@code TodoTask} is the simplest type of {@link Task},
* defined only be a description and its state of completion.
